title: How to Download Android Apps: The Complete Beginner's Guide

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store .
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store . Tap the icon that looks like a multicolored sideways triangle in your app list. This app is usually called "Play Store," but may just be called "Google Play" on some Android phones and tablets. [1] X Research source If it’s your first time opening the Play Store, you’ll have to enter your Google account information and payment details. Follow the on-screen instructions when prompted.

steps.title: Type an app name or keyword into the search box.
steps.content: Type an app name or keyword into the search box. It’s at the top of the screen. [2] X Research source For example, you can type wikihow to search for the wikiHow app, or photos to browse various photo apps. If you’re just browsing, skip the search—instead, scroll down and peruse the Play Store’s categories, charts, and suggestions. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . It’s the Search key that looks like a magnifying glass at the keyboard’s bottom right corner. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select an app from the search results.
steps.content: Select an app from the search results. This brings you to the details page, where you can read the app’s description, check out user reviews, and view screenshots. [5] X Research source Many apps have similar names, so your search may return several results. Apps in the search result appear on their own “tiles,” each displaying the app’s icon, developer, star rating, and price.

steps.title: Tap INSTALL.
steps.content: Tap INSTALL . It’s a green button just beneath the name of the app. If the app is not free , the green button will say the app’s price instead of “INSTALL” (e.g. “$2.49”). [6] X Research source When downloading an app that costs money, you may have to confirm your Google account password.

steps.title: Tap OPEN.
steps.content: Tap OPEN . When the installation is complete, the “INSTALL” (or price) button will change to an “OPEN” button. Tapping it will launch your new app for the first time. To open the new app in the future, tap the Apps icon on your home screen, then tap the new app’s icon.
